subject: Investing
title: Brokerages and How to Start
description: A fast breakdown of Brokerages and How to Start for builders.

hook.text: In 1990, a single stock trade cost $50 in commission. Today, most brokers charge exactly zero.

buildup.text: A brokerage is the middleman between you and the stock market. You need one to buy your first share.

discovery.text: Fidelity, Schwab, and Vanguard are full-service. Robinhood popularized free trades and mobile-first design.

twist.text: Free doesn't mean no cost. Robinhood earns from payment for order flow â€” selling your trades to market makers.

climax.text: The best broker is the one with low fees, good tools, and no pressure to trade. Boring is usually better.

punchline.text: Opening a brokerage account takes 10 minutes. Building wealth takes decades.

quiz.question: How do zero-commission brokerages like Robinhood make money?
options: Payment for order flow from market makers
Monthly subscription fees from all users
